column1: Barinas (Spanish pronunciation: [baˈɾinas]) is a city in west central Venezuela. According to the 2011 census
column3: 442. It is the capital of the Barinas Municipality and the State of Barinas. The city of Barinas is known as the capital of the Llanos.

column1: The original city was founded under the name Altamira de Caceres on June 30
column2: 1577 by Captain Juan Andres Varela fulfilling orders of the governor of La Grita Francisco de Cáceres
column3: who had founded this Andean city and established it governorate in 1576.

column1: In 1786 Barinas state was established in the territories of the existing states of Barinas and Apure. The city became the capital of the state and an important bastion of the patriots during the War of Independence. Cristóbal Mendoza
column3: lived and practiced his profession in Barinas.

column1: The name of the city comes from an indigenous word which identifies a strong wind that occurs during the rainy season
column2: from the valleys of Santo Domingo.

column1: The city is located in the northwest part of the state
column2: along the river Santo Domingo in the Andean foothills about 165 km from the city of Mérida and 525 km from Caracas. The city has about 270
column3: 000 inhabitants and is the most populous in the state of Barinas and one of the largest Venezuelan llanos cities alongside Calabozo
column5: Guanare and San Fernando de Apure. The city is located about 188 meters above sea level.

column1: The city has become an important administrative centre being the headquarters of major educational institutions such as the National Experimental University of the Western Plains "Ezequiel Zamora" and the more immediate market for everything produced in the state both in the field of agriculture and animal husbandry and oil exploitation. In recent years an important tourist industry has emerged in the city since it has served as a base or point of entry to all eco-tourism locations in the region of Western Plains.LAI - Línea Aérea IAACA
column3: had its headquarters on the grounds of Barinas Airport in Barinas.

column2: consisting of 5 lines that run throughout the city with over 80 different routes. It also has a large number of taxis or rental cars providing additional transportation services in the city.
